intro: Neckeria curvisiliqua, commonly known as the spiral liverwort, is a small, aquatic liverwort belonging to the family Marchantiaceae. It is characterized by its unique spiral arrangement of leaves, which gives it a distinctive appearance. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as stream banks and damp soil. Its structure consists of a thalloid body with leaf-like structures arranged in a helical pattern. Neckeria curvisiliqua plays a role in aquatic ecosystems by contributing to nutrient cycling and providing habitat for microorganisms.
